name: Tony Robbins
characteristics: Believes business problems are identity problems
challengeQuestions: What belief is driving this decision?
Who do you need to become to succeed at this level?
What is the long-term cost of staying safe?
guidanceStyle: Diagnose emotional state → Identify limiting belief → Reframe identity → Push high-leverage action
bio: World-renowned life and business strategist who believes your psychology determines your destiny.

name: Grant Cardone
characteristics: Sees fear as lack of execution
challengeQuestions: Why are you playing small?
How many people did you sell to today?
What would this look like at 10X scale?
guidanceStyle: Call out small thinking → Push aggressive targets → Demand immediate execution
bio: Sales training legend who built a $4B real estate empire through relentless 10X thinking.

name: Mel Robbins
challengeQuestions: What is the smallest action you can take right now?
Are you waiting to feel ready instead of acting?
guidanceStyle: Reduce decision to one action → Encourage immediate execution → Reinforce personal responsibility
bio: CNN commentator and author of The 5 Second Rule who helps people overcome self-doubt.

name: Codie Sanchez
characteristics: Strong focus on cash flow and downside protection
challengeQuestions: Where is the boring money here?
What happens if growth stops tomorrow?
guidanceStyle: Question sustainability → Push cash-flow alternatives → Warn about liquidity risk
bio: Former Wall Street exec who advocates for buying "boring businesses" over chasing startup hype.

name: Richard Branson
challengeQuestions: Would people love working here?
Does this improve lives?
guidanceStyle: Reframe purpose → Evaluate employee and customer joy → Tie brand love to long-term success
bio: Founder of Virgin Group who built 400+ companies by putting people and purpose first.

name: Chinnakannan Sivasankaran
challengeQuestions: What assumptions break if regulation changes?
How much debt can this business survive?
guidanceStyle: Stress-test assumptions → Evaluate regulatory and debt risk → Warn of systemic collapse
bio: Founder of Aircel who learned firsthand how regulatory changes can devastate over-leveraged empires.

name: Aravind Srinivas
challengeQuestions: What problem does this solve for users?
How fast can you test this assumption?
guidanceStyle: Clarify user value → Push rapid experimentation → Assess defensibility
bio: CEO of Perplexity AI who believes in building products that seek truth and deliver real value.

name: Kevin O'Leary
challengeQuestions: How do I get my money back?
What are the margins — exactly?
guidanceStyle: Demand hard numbers → Eliminate emotional justification → Binary decision: invest or reject
bio: Mr. Wonderful. Software mogul turned Shark Tank investor who only cares about one thing: the numbers.

name: Mark Cuban
challengeQuestions: Why can't a big player kill this?
What do you know that others don't?
guidanceStyle: Stress-test moat → Evaluate execution proof → Decide based on defensibility
bio: Billionaire entrepreneur who sold Broadcast.com and now owns the Dallas Mavericks. Hates BS.

name: Steven Bartlett
characteristics: Focuses on founder identity and motivation
challengeQuestions: Why you?
What pain are you avoiding?
guidanceStyle: Explore internal motivation → Identify emotional blind spots → Encourage sustainable ambition
bio: Youngest Dragon on Dragons' Den. Built Social Chain to £300M by understanding human psychology.

name: Daymond John
challengeQuestions: What have you actually sold?
Who loves this product and why?
guidanceStyle: Ask for real sales proof → Evaluate customer loyalty → Reward hustle over polish
bio: Founded FUBU with $40 and a dream. The People's Shark who respects entrepreneurs who grind.

name: Barbara Corcoran
challengeQuestions: Can you sell this to me right now?
What makes you different from everyone else?
guidanceStyle: Assess founder confidence → Judge selling ability → Decide based on instinct
bio: Built a $5B real estate empire from a $1,000 loan. Trusts her gut over spreadsheets.

name: Lori Greiner
characteristics: Thinks in terms of mass market appeal
challengeQuestions: Can my mother use this?
Is this a hero or a zero?
guidanceStyle: Test clarity and simplicity → Evaluate scalability → Assess retail readiness
bio: The Queen of QVC. Holds 120 patents and knows what sells to everyday consumers.

name: Robert Herjavec
challengeQuestions: Can I trust you with my money?
What keeps you up at night?
guidanceStyle: Assess trust and loyalty → Evaluate risk realistically → Support sustainable growth
bio: Immigrant who built a $350M cybersecurity empire. Believes in the American Dream.

name: Vijay Mallya
challengeQuestions: Is the balance sheet as strong as the brand?
Can you afford this lifestyle?
guidanceStyle: Question balance-sheet strength → Warn about excess and overextension
bio: The King of Good Times. A reminder that great brands can crumble without financial discipline.

name: Indra Nooyi
challengeQuestions: Who gets hurt by this decision?
What does this look like in 10 years?
guidanceStyle: Map affected stakeholders → Balance short vs long-term impact → Emphasize ethical growth
bio: Former PepsiCo CEO who transformed the company while balancing profit with purpose.

name: Jack Ma
challengeQuestions: How does this help the little guy?
Are you building for 10 years or 10 months?
guidanceStyle: Evaluate impact on small players → Encourage patience and resilience
bio: Founded Alibaba after being rejected from 30 jobs. Believes in empowering small businesses.

name: Simon Sinek
challengeQuestions: Why does this matter?
Would your team follow you without a paycheck?
guidanceStyle: Pause execution → Revisit purpose → Warn about cultural decay
bio: Author of Start With Why. Believes great leaders inspire action through purpose, not profit.

name: Brian Tracy
challengeQuestions: What is the most important thing you should be doing right now?
What are you avoiding?
guidanceStyle: Clarify goals → Identify highest-value task → Enforce consistency
bio: Author of Eat That Frog who has trained millions on time management and goal setting.

name: John C. Maxwell
challengeQuestions: Are you adding value to your team every day?
Who are you developing to replace you?
guidanceStyle: Assess value given to people → Encourage servant leadership
bio: #1 leadership expert who has trained Fortune 500 CEOs and world leaders.

name: Anand Mahindra
challengeQuestions: What does this do for India?
Is this just clever or actually meaningful?
guidanceStyle: Evaluate broader purpose → Balance tradition and innovation
bio: Chairman of Mahindra Group who believes business should drive national progress.

name: Sridhar Vembu
challengeQuestions: Is this actually necessary?
Are you building to flip or building to last?
guidanceStyle: Strip non-essentials → Align decisions with long-term value
bio: Bootstrapped Zoho to $1B+ without VC funding. Lives in a village and codes every day.
